physical_appearance: This is a manuscript plan of a church service. It is drawn and inscribed in pencil. The document is divided vertically along the center with a line. There are several diagrams and lists on either side. There is a small hole on the top left of the document.
sgcool_label_text: This is a detailed manuscript plan for a 1944 church service and party organised for 122nd Field Regiment written on the verso of a typed memo from Singapore Inspector of Prisons (1938), with Steele's manuscript invitation. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Detailed manuscript plan for a 1944 church service and party organised for 122nd Field Regiment (2 pieces) 1944 Church service and Christmas party manuscript plan
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) handwriting
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Writing
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
